definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Legalism destroys our loving relationship with God.
sentences.chinese: 教条主义毁灭我们与上帝之间的爱。

sentences.english: However, He catches obvious dogmatism and often neglects the creative experience.
sentences.chinese: 一个染上明显的教条主义，常常“忘记”创作经验。

sentences.english: He is extremely critical of dogmatism of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 他是非常关键的任何形式的教条主义。

sentences.english: The Lady is at the dogmatic heart of this relentlessly didactic work of literature.
sentences.chinese: 这个夫人就是文学教条主义，不懈的说教工作的核心。

sentences.english: Dogmatism is puppyish come to its full growth.
sentences.chinese: 教条主义是盲目自高自大的全副面目。

sentences.english: Pinko dogmatism is the most remarkable character of the controversy.
sentences.chinese: 中苏大论战最大的特点是左倾教条主义。

sentences.english: Dogmatism, which is extremely harmful to Marxism, is an anti-Marxism style of study.
sentences.chinese: 教条主义是一种危害极大的反马克思主义的学风。

definition: adventurism (a left-wing error against Mao's line during the 1930s)
leftist opportunism (blamed for failures of Chinese communists from 1927)/left adventurism/cf Mao's purges following 1935 Zunyi conference 遵義會議|遵义会议[Zun1 yi4 hui4 yi4]
pinyin: zuo3 qing1 ji1 hui4 zhu3 yi4

definition: drab, stereotypical Communist Party writing style
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
